Context:
Program Name: English for Professional Success (EPS)
Code: R902
Credential: George Brown College Certificate
Method of Study: Part-time
Duration: Must complete the program within three consecutive academic years.
Starting Months: January, May, September
Centre: Preparative & Liberal Studies
School: English as a Second Language ESL
Location: St. James Campus
Program Description: George Brown College's English for Professional Success Certificate program is intended for non-native speakers with advanced-level English skills, offering classes on evenings and weekends to accommodate working professionals. The certificate requires completion of three core courses and two electives.
Year Availability:
- Fall 2024: Continuous Open Enrollment, Not Study Permit Eligible
- Winter 2025: Continuous Open Enrollment, Not Study Permit Eligible
- Spring 2025: Continuous Open Enrollment, Not Study Permit Eligible.

Context:
Program Name: ESL (English as a Second Language)
Certificate Level: Advanced-level
Required Courses:
1. Core Courses:
   - ESL 9081: Canadian Workplace Culture: Expectations and Communication Styles: $343.00
   - ESL 9082: Business Communication for Professionals: $329.00
   - ESL 9083: ESL Business Writing for Professionals: $329.00
2. Electives:
   - ESL 9070: Pronunciation and Fluency: $316.00
   - ESL 9064: Listening and Persuasive Speech: $316.00
Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: Please see the Courses tab for fee details
- International Tuition: Please see the Courses tab for fee details
Admission Requirements:
- Complete ESL 9068 (ESL IIIB ADVANCED) or have an equivalent English placement test result prior to taking core courses
- Prior to enrolling in any elective courses, complete ESL 9067 (ESL IIIA LOW ADVANCED) or have the equivalent English placement test
Special Requirements:
- Achieve a grade of B (73%) or better to successfully complete each course
- Complete three core courses and your choice of two electives to achieve the advanced-level certificate
Placement Test:
- Visit Continuing Education (partâ€“time) ESL Program Placement Test Registration to write the level placement test for program entry.

Context:
To apply for the Continuing Education (part-time) ESL Program, domestic students should visit the Courses section and register directly in their respective course(s). International students of R902 program do not need to apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. For more information, contact the English for Academic Purposes office at 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or email conedesl@georgebrown.ca. Domestic students can visit the English for Academ academic Purposes Program (R105), while international students should visit the English for Academic Purposes Program (R115). The courses in this program are for continuing education purposes only, and to earn credits toward a full-time George Brown program, students can enroll in the English for Academic Purposes program.

Contact Information:
- George Brown College Contact Centre: 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance at 1-800-265-2002
- English for Academic Purposes office: 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or email conedesl@georgebrown.ca

Programs and Registration:
- Continuing Education (part-time) ESL Program: registration required after program registration
- English for Academic Purposes Program (R105) for domestic students
- English for Academic Purposes Program (R115) for international students

Virtual Campus Tour and Sign up:
- Virtual tour available on the website
- Option to sign up to receive tailored resources and information about George Brown College, programs, and life at the college.
